content:
TableStyle Class

In this Article

Represents the style for the Table control and some Web Parts.

Syntax

Declaration

public class TableStyle : System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • MarshalByRefObject
  • Component
  • System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style
  • TableStyle

Remarks

The TableStyle class is used to represent the style for a table control. It encapsulates the properties that control the appearance of a table and can be applied to multiple table controls to provide a common appearance.

You can specify an image to display in the background of the table by setting the BackImageUrl property. The amount of spacing between the cells of a table is controlled by the CellSpacing property. The spacing between the contents of a cell and the cell border is specified using the CellPadding property. You can specify whether cell borders are displayed by setting the GridLines property. The horizontal alignment of the table in relation to other elements on the Web Forms page is indicated by the HorizontalAlign property.

Note

This class is primarily used by control developers.

Constructors summary

TableStyle()

Initializes a new instance of the TableStyle class using default values.
TableStyle(StateBag)

Initializes a new instance of the TableStyle class with the specified state bag information.

Properties summary

BackImageUrl

Gets or sets the URL of an image to display in the background of a table control.
CellPadding

Gets or sets the amount of space between the contents of the cell and the cell's border.
CellSpacing

Gets or sets the distance between table cells.
GridLines

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the border between the cells of the table control is displayed.
HorizontalAlign

Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the table within its container.

Methods summary

AddAttributesToRender(HtmlTextWriter,WebControl)

Adds information about the background image, cell spacing, cell padding, gridlines, and alignment to the list of attributes to render.
CopyFrom(Style)

Copies non-blank elements from the specified style, overwriting existing style elements if necessary.
FillStyleAttributes(CssStyleCollection,IUrlResolutionService)

Adds the style properties of the TableStyle object to the specified CssStyleCollection collection.
MergeWith(Style)

Copies non-blank elements from the specified style, but will not overwrite any existing style elements.
Reset()

Clears any defined style elements of the style.

Constructors

  • TableStyle()

    Initializes a new instance of the TableStyle class using default values.

    public TableStyle ();

    Remarks

    Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the TableStyle class using default values.

  • TableStyle(StateBag)

    Initializes a new instance of the TableStyle class with the specified state bag information.

    public TableStyle (System.Web.UI.StateBag bag);

    Parameters

    • bag
      StateBag

      A StateBag that represents the state bag in which to store style information.

    Remarks

    Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the TableStyle class using the specified System.Web.UI.StateBag.

Properties

  • BackImageUrl

    Gets or sets the URL of an image to display in the background of a table control.

    public virtual string BackImageUrl { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The URL of an image to display in the background of a table control. The default is String.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The URL of the background image was set to null.

    Remarks

    Use the BackImageUrl property to specify the URL of an image to display in the background of the table control.

    Note

    The image will be tiled if it is smaller than the table. Similarly, the image is cropped if it is larger than the table.

    The value of this property is stored in view state.

  • CellPadding

    Gets or sets the amount of space between the contents of the cell and the cell's border.

    public virtual int CellPadding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The distance (in pixels) between the contents of a cell and the cell's border. The default is -1, which indicates that this property is not set.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The specified distance is set to a value less than -1.

    Remarks

    Use the CellPadding property to control the spacing between the contents of a cell and the cell's border. The padding amount specified is added to all four sides of a cell.

    All cells in the same column of a data listing control share the same cell width. Therefore, if the content of one cell is longer than the content of other cells in the same column, the padding amount is applied to the widest cell. All other cells in the column are also set with this cell width.

    Similarly, all cells in the same row share the same height. The padding amount is applied to the height of the tallest cell in the row. All other cells in the same row are set with this cell height. Individual cell sizes cannot be specified.

    The value of this property is stored in view state.

  • CellSpacing

    Gets or sets the distance between table cells.

    public virtual int CellSpacing { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The distance (in pixels) between table cells. The default is -1, which indicates that this property is not set.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The specified distance is set to a value less than -1.

    Remarks

    Use the CellSpacing property to control the spacing between adjacent cells in a data listing control. This spacing is applied both vertically and horizontally. The cell spacing is uniform for the entire data list control. Individual cell spacing between each row or column cannot be specified.

    Note

    If you set this property to a value greater than 0 and set the GridLines property to a value that displays the cell borders, a gap is displayed between the borders of adjacent cells. In this situation, the CellSpacing property controls the size of the gap.

    The value of this property is stored in view state.

  • GridLines

    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the border between the cells of the table control is displayed.

    public virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridLines GridLines { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • GridLines

      One of the GridLines enumeration values. The default is Both.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The specified value is not one of the GridLines enumeration values.

    Remarks

    Use the GridLines property to specify whether the border between the cells of the data list control is displayed. This property is set with one of the GridLines enumeration values. The following table lists the possible values.

    Value Description
    GridLines No cell border is displayed.
    GridLines Only the upper and lower borders of the cells in the data list control are displayed.
    GridLines Only the left and right borders of the cells in the data list control are displayed.
    GridLines All borders of the cells in the data list control are displayed.

    The value of this property is stored in view state.

  • HorizontalAlign

    Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the table within its container.

    public virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign HorizontalAlign { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • HorizontalAlign

      One of the HorizontalAlign enumeration values. The default is NotSet.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The specified horizontal alignment is not one of the HorizontalAlign enumeration values.

    Remarks

    Use the HorizontalAlign property to specify the horizontal alignment of the data list control within its container. This property is set with one of the HorizontalAlign enumeration values. The following table lists the possible values.

    Value Description
    HorizontalAlign The horizontal alignment is not set.
    HorizontalAlign The table is left justified within its container.
    HorizontalAlign The table is centered within its container.
    HorizontalAlign The table is right justified within its container.

    The value of this property is stored in view state.

Methods

  • AddAttributesToRender(HtmlTextWriter,WebControl)

    Adds information about the background image, cell spacing, cell padding, gridlines, and alignment to the list of attributes to render.

    public override void AddAttributesToRender (System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer, System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl owner);

    Parameters

    • writer
      HtmlTextWriter

      The output stream that renders HTML content to the client.

    • owner
      WebControl

      The control associated with the style.

    Remarks

    This method is primarily used by control developers.

  • CopyFrom(Style)

    Copies non-blank elements from the specified style, overwriting existing style elements if necessary.

    public override void CopyFrom (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s);

    Parameters

    • s
      System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style

      The style to copy.

  • FillStyleAttributes(CssStyleCollection,IUrlResolutionService)

    Adds the style properties of the TableStyle object to the specified CssStyleCollection collection.

    protected override void FillStyleAttributes (System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection attributes, System.Web.UI.IUrlResolutionService urlResolver);

    Parameters

    • attributes
      CssStyleCollection

      The CssStyleCollection to which to add the style properties.

    • urlResolver
      IUrlResolutionService

      An object implemented by the IUrlResolutionService that contains the context information for the current location (URL).

    Remarks

    Use the FillStyleAttributes method to add the style properties of the TableStyle object to the specified System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection collection.

  • MergeWith(Style)

    Copies non-blank elements from the specified style, but will not overwrite any existing style elements.

    public override void MergeWith (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s);

    Parameters

    • s
      System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style

      The style to copy.

  • Reset()

    Clears any defined style elements of the style.

    public override void Reset ();

    Remarks

    Clears any defined style elements, and leaves the style in the default state.
